greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The least missing nonzero digit in the primorial base expansion of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..32786
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
example: 19 in primorial base (A049345) is written as "301". The least missing nonzero digit is 2, thus a(19) = 2.
809 in primorial base is written as "35421". The least missing nonzero digit is 6, thus a(809) = 6, and this is also the first position where 6 appears in this sequence.
program: (PARI) A329028(n) = { my(m=Map(), p=2); while(n, mapput(m,(n%p),1); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); for(k=1,oo,if(!mapisdefined(m,k),return(k))); };
xref: Cf. A328840 (the positions of ones in this sequence).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 03 2019
